overview_of_class: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Development of elements from variational principles and applications to static continuum problems. Introduction to techniques for dynamics, stability and generalized filed problems. Students completing the course are expected to be able to understand the theory o finite elements and its application in analysis and design, architecture of finite element computer programs, variational and Galerkin methods and their application one dimension elasticity, applications to two-dimensional and axisymmetric three-dimensional elasticity and heat conduction problems, analysis of bar and plate with hole and comparison with closed form solutions using well-known finite element commercial code.
name: Finite Element Methods in Mechanics
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 327-0-20 Finite Element Methods in Mechanics

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Matrix algebra, strength of materials, knowledge of computing. Primary audience are seniors and graduates in civil and mechanical engineering.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
CLASS SCHEDULE / Two 1.5-hr lecture periods per week.

COMPUTER USAGE / Computer programming stressed, with MATLAB as the official programming language. Finite element commercial software ABAQUS is adopted to offer students extra opportunity to get experience in the industrial engineering community.
